Class MdFile

Namespace
MdFilesMerger.Domain.Common
Assembly
MdFilesMerger.Domain.dll

Base class for all models associated with .md files (merged, selected and ignored file models).

Inheritance: BaseItem -> BaseDirectory -> MdFile
Implements: IComparable<T>, IDirectory, IItem 

public class MdFile : BaseDirectory, IComparable<BaseDirectory>, IDirectory, IItem

IComparable<T>

IItem

MdFile(int, string?)

Sets Id to id, Name to adjusted path and ModifiedDate to Now.

public MdFile(int id, string? path)

Parameters

id int

This item identification number.

path string

Path to the .md file associated with this item. It can include extension or not.

Remarks

If path is a valid path to .md file, Name is set to path to this file, that uses '/' as directory separator character. Otherwise Name is set to null.

See Also

BaseItem
IComparable<T>

IItem

MdFile(int, string?, DateTime)

Sets Id to id, Name to path and ModifiedDate to modifiedDate.

public MdFile(int id, string? path, DateTime modifiedDate)

Parameters

id int

The item identification number.

path string

Valid path to .md file associated with this item. Path should use '/' as directory separator.

modifiedDate DateTime

Date and time of last modification of this entity.

Remarks

No evaluation or adjusting is performed, so use this method only for already evaluated and prepared data, for example from database.

public MdFile(string? path)

Parameters

path string

Path to the .md file associated with this item. It can include extension or not.

Remarks

BaseDirectory

IComparable<T>
IDirectory
IItem

Methods

SetPath(string?)

Sets Name as adjusted path.

public override bool SetPath(string? path)

Parameters

path string

Valid absolute or relative path to the .md file, that you want to associate with this item.

Returns

bool
  • true if Name was successfully set.
  • false if Name was set to null

Remarks

Checks if given path is valid (doesn't contain any invalid path characters). If it is valid, sets Name as given path using '/' as directory separator character. Otherwise it sets Name to null. If path doesn't end with ".md" it adds this extension to path.
